attributes.action: Give us the vote this May!
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Reading about John Bercow who is the speaker as well as MP for Buckinghamshire, we find that we are denied the right to vote in the coming elections. This is not right. Also we cannot ask a question as he is not allowed to ask questions in the house. Even prisoners have the right to vote in an election. Would you please give us our constitutional right before May 6th! Please.

rejection.details: Although it is often the convention that the main political parties do not put forward candidates in the Speaker's constituency, there is not a rule denying residents of that constituency the right to vote in a General Election. Another candidate has announced his intention to run against John Bercow in the forthcoming election. If you feel that political parties should be fielding candidates in your constituency, you should contact the parties directly.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
